title: Split manager.rs into focused modules

## Problem

config/manager.rs is 1,625 lines handling too many responsibilities:
- JSONC comment stripping (lines 15-98)
- MCP extraction (100-144)
- Data structs ProfileInfo/McpServerInfo/ResourceSummary (147-197)
- ProfileManager CRUD operations (199-508)
- show_profile with all extractors (510-583)
- Harness-specific extractors for theme/model/skills/commands/plugins/agents/rules (585-1141)
- Backup/switch logic (1239-1407)
- Tests (1409-1625)

## Recommendation

Split into focused modules:

```
src/config/
├── mod.rs
├── bridle.rs           # BridleConfig (existing)
├── profile_name.rs     # ProfileName (existing)
├── manager.rs          # ProfileManager CRUD only (~400 lines)
├── parser/
│   ├── mod.rs          # JSONC utilities, strip_comments, strip_trailing_commas
│   ├── opencode.rs     # OpenCode-specific parsing
│   ├── claude.rs       # Claude Code-specific parsing
│   ├── goose.rs        # Goose-specific parsing (YAML, GOOSE_* keys)
│   └── amp.rs          # AMP Code-specific parsing
└── extractors.rs       # MCP, resources, theme, model extraction
```

## Benefits

- Easier to navigate and maintain
- Harness-specific logic isolated
- Easier to add new harnesses
- Tests can be co-located with modules

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] manager.rs reduced to <500 lines
- [ ] Each harness parser in its own file
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] No public API changes


4. **After fix**: Should also copy:
   - settings.json (from ~/.claude/settings.json or ~/.claude.json)
   - .mcp.json (if exists at ~/.claude/.mcp.json)


title: Extract shared CLI/TUI display logic
description:
## Problem

Display logic is duplicated across three locations, violating the architecture principle documented in AGENTS.md.

| Component | Location | Lines |
|-----------|----------|-------|
| CLI profile display | cli/profile.rs → print_profile_text() | ~100 |
| TUI profile display | tui/mod.rs → render_profile_expanded() | ~165 |
| TUI detail pane | tui/widgets/detail_pane.rs → render_profile_details() | ~165 |

**Critical**: render_profile_expanded() and render_profile_details() are near-identical copies with the same Section enum defined twice. This is a DRY violation within TUI itself.

## Recommendation

Create a shared display module:

```rust
// src/display/mod.rs
pub struct ProfileSection {
    pub label: &'static str,
    pub value: Option<String>,
    pub children: Vec<ProfileSection>,
}

pub fn profile_to_sections(info: &ProfileInfo) -> Vec<ProfileSection>
```

## Caveat

CLI uses flat println! output while TUI uses tree-branch formatting (├─/└─). Need either:
- A DisplayFormat enum parameter, or
- A Renderer trait with CLI/TUI implementations

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Single source of truth for display data structure
- [ ] CLI and TUI consume the same intermediate representation
- [ ] No duplicate Section enums
- [ ] Feature parity guaranteed between CLI and TUI

title: Implement MCP config read/write helpers for all harnesses
description:
# Task: Implement MCP Config Read/Write Helpers

## Context

Each harness stores MCP configuration differently. We need helpers to read existing config, merge new MCPs, and write back without losing data.

## Config Locations and Formats

| Harness | File | Key | Format |
|---------|------|-----|--------|
| Claude Code | .mcp.json | mcpServers | JSON |
| OpenCode | opencode.jsonc | mcp | JSONC (JSON with comments) |
| Goose | config.yaml | extensions | YAML |
| AMP Code | settings.json | "amp.mcpServers" | JSON (literal string key) |

## File to Create: src/install/mcp_config.rs

### Required Functions

```rust
use harness_locate::{Harness, HarnessKind, McpServer};
use std::path::Path;
use std::collections::HashMap;

/// Read existing MCP servers from a harness config file
/// Returns empty HashMap if file doesn't exist or has no MCPs
pub fn read_mcp_config(
    kind: HarnessKind,
    config_path: &Path,
) -> Result<HashMap<String, serde_json::Value>, McpConfigError>

/// Write MCP servers to a harness config file (additive merge)
/// Preserves existing MCPs and other config fields
/// CRITICAL: Must preserve YAML comments for Goose
pub fn write_mcp_config(
    kind: HarnessKind,
    config_path: &Path,
    servers: &HashMap<String, serde_json::Value>,
) -> Result<(), McpConfigError>

/// Check if an MCP with the given name exists in config
pub fn mcp_exists(
    kind: HarnessKind,
    config_path: &Path,
    name: &str,
) -> Result<bool, McpConfigError>

/// Get the JSON key path for MCP servers in this harness
fn get_mcp_key(kind: HarnessKind) -> &'static str {
    match kind {
        HarnessKind::ClaudeCode => "mcpServers",
        HarnessKind::OpenCode => "mcp",
        HarnessKind::Goose => "extensions",
        HarnessKind::AmpCode => "amp.mcpServers", // literal key, not nested
    }
}
```

### Error Type

```rust
#[derive(Debug, thiserror::Error)]
pub enum McpConfigError {
    #[error("Failed to read config file: {0}")]
    ReadError(#[from] std::io::Error),
    
    #[error("Failed to parse JSON: {0}")]
    JsonParseError(#[from] serde_json::Error),
    
    #[error("Failed to parse YAML: {0}")]
    YamlParseError(String),
    
    #[error("Failed to parse JSONC: {0}")]
    JsoncParseError(String),
    
    #[error("Failed to write config: {0}")]
    WriteError(String),
}
```

## Implementation Details

### JSON (Claude, AMP)
- Use `serde_json` for read/write
- For AMP, the key is literally `"amp.mcpServers"` as a string, NOT nested under `amp.mcpServers`
- Example AMP structure: `{"amp.mcpServers": {"mcp-name": {...}}}`

### JSONC (OpenCode)
- Use existing `crate::config::jsonc` module
- Check what's already implemented there
- JSONC = JSON with // and /* */ comments
- Comments should be preserved on write

### YAML (Goose)
- **CRITICAL**: Must preserve comments when rewriting
- Use a YAML library that supports comment preservation
- Recommended: Check if `serde_yaml` preserves comments, if not use `yaml-rust2` or similar
- The `extensions` key contains MCPs mixed with other extension types
- Filter by checking for MCP-specific fields (command/cmd, type: "stdio", etc.)

### Goose Extensions Structure
```yaml
extensions:
  developer:
    enabled: true
    type: builtin
  my-mcp-server:  # This is an MCP
    type: stdio
    cmd: npx
    args: ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-fetch"]
    envs:
      API_KEY: "${API_KEY}"
```

## Verification Steps

1. Unit tests for each harness format
2. Test reading non-existent file (should return empty HashMap)
3. Test reading file with no MCPs (should return empty HashMap)
4. Test additive merge (existing MCPs preserved)
5. Test YAML comment preservation specifically

## Dependencies

- This task blocks: "Implement core MCP installation function"
- Depends on: "Update harness-locate to 0.3"
close_reason: MCP config helpers implemented with read/write/exists functions for all 4 harnesses

title: Profile creation skips resource directories (agent/, command/, skill/)

## Problem
When creating a profile with `--from-current`, only config FILES are copied to the profile storage. Resource directories (agent/, command/, skill/) are skipped because `copy_config_files` at line 257 only copies entries where `is_file()` is true.

## Evidence
- Live config at `~/.config/opencode/` HAS `agent/` and `command/` directories
- Profile storage at `~/.config/bridle/profiles/opencode/maestro/` has NO directories, only files
- TUI shows '(directory not found)' for Agents, Skills, Commands

`src/config/manager.rs` line 257:
```rust
if entry.file_type()?.is_file() {  // <-- ONLY FILES
    let dest = profile_path.join(entry.file_name());
    std::fs::copy(entry.path(), &dest)?;
}
```

## Fix
Modify `copy_config_files` to also recursively copy resource directories when `source_is_live=true`. The harness provides directory names via `harness.agents()`, `harness.commands()`, `harness.skills()` - use these to identify which directories to copy.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `profile create <harness> <name> --from-current` copies agent/, command/, skill/ directories
- `profile show` displays resources correctly for both CLI and TUI
- Existing profiles may need migration or re-creation

# Task: YAML Comment Preservation for Goose Config

## Context

Goose uses `config.yaml` which users often annotate with comments. When we modify the `extensions` section to add MCPs, we MUST preserve these comments.

## Problem

Standard YAML libraries (like `serde_yaml`) typically discard comments during parsing. We need a solution that preserves them.

## Research Required

Check available Rust YAML libraries for comment preservation:

1. **yaml-rust2** - Fork of yaml-rust with more features
2. **yaml-split** - May support preserving structure
3. **serde_yaml** with custom deserializer - May be possible
4. **String manipulation** - Parse only the part we need, preserve rest

## Recommended Approach

Option A: **Targeted insertion** (preferred if feasible)
- Read file as string
- Find `extensions:` section
- Parse only that section
- Insert new MCP entry
- Write back with rest of file intact

Option B: **Comment-preserving library**
- Use a library that preserves comments
- May require mapping between library's types and serde

Option C: **yaml-rust2 with manual handling**
- yaml-rust2 preserves more structure
- May need manual comment tracking

```rust
    servers: &HashMap<String, serde_json::Value>,
) -> Result<(), McpConfigError> {

}
```

```rust
    let original = r#"
# Main Goose configuration
GOOSE_PROVIDER: anthropic  # Using Anthropic
GOOSE_MODEL: claude-sonnet-4-20250514

# Extensions section
extensions:
  # Built-in developer tools

"#;

}

fn test_yaml_existing_mcps_preserved() {
```

## Parent Epic
bridle-xgw: Nushell-friendly structured output for CLI display commands

## Objective
Add global `--output` / `-o` flag to the main CLI struct so it's available to all subcommands.

## File to Modify: src/main.rs

### Current State
```rust
#[derive(Parser)]
#[command(author, version, about, long_about = None)]
struct Cli {
    #[command(subcommand)]
    command: Commands,
}
```

```rust
use crate::cli::output::OutputFormat;

#[derive(Parser)]
#[command(author, version, about, long_about = None)]
struct Cli {
    /// Output format: text, json, or auto (default: auto)
    /// 
    /// Auto-detects Nushell and uses JSON, otherwise text.
    #[arg(long, short = 'o', default_value = "auto", global = true)]
    output: OutputFormat,

    #[command(subcommand)]
    command: Commands,
}
```

Update command dispatch to pass the resolved format:

```rust
fn main() -> Result<()> {
    let cli = Cli::parse();
    let format = cli.output.resolve();

    match cli.command {
        Commands::Status => cli::status::display_status(format)?,
        Commands::Profile(cmd) => cli::profile::handle_command(cmd, format)?,
```

```rust
pub fn list_profiles(harness: &str, format: ResolvedFormat) -> Result<()>

```

# Epic: MCP Installation from GitHub Repositories

Implement full functionality for `bridle install` of MCPs (Model Context Protocol servers) from GitHub repositories into various agentic harnesses.

## Background

Bridle can already install skills, agents, and commands. This epic adds MCP installation support, which is more complex because:
1. Each harness uses different config formats (YAML vs JSON vs JSONC)
2. Each harness stores MCP config in different locations and structures

|---------|-------------|-----------|--------|
| Claude Code | .mcp.json | /mcpServers | JSON |
| OpenCode | opencode.jsonc | /mcp | JSONC |
| Goose | config.yaml | /extensions | YAML |
| AMP Code | settings.json | "amp.mcpServers" (literal key) | JSON |

```rust
// Convert MCP server to harness-native format
let native_value = server.to_native_value(HarnessKind::ClaudeCode, &name)?;
```

4. Existing MCPs in config are preserved (additive merge)

6. Unresolved env vars trigger a warning but don't block installation
7. YAML comments are preserved when modifying Goose config
8. All 4 harnesses supported: Claude, OpenCode, Goose, AMP

description:
# TUI Redesign Epic

## Problem Statement
The current TUI wastes space and hides information:
- Right 2/3 of screen empty when no profile expanded
- Users must expand to see model, MCPs, plugins, theme
- Vertical harness list takes 30% width for only 3 items
- No visual hierarchy for active profile
- No at-a-glance summary for comparing profiles

## Solution
Implement two view modes:
1. **Dashboard View** (default): Three-pane layout with always-visible details
2. **Card View** (feature-gated): Grid of profile cards with inline summaries

## Key Design Decisions
| Decision | Choice |
|----------|--------|
| Default view | Dashboard |
| Card view | Behind `tui-cards` Cargo feature |
| Enter key | Switch to profile (both views) |
| Space key | Show/toggle details |
| Help modal | Single modal, adapts to view |
| View config | In config.toml, user edits directly |
| View toggle hotkey | None - config file only |

## Keyboard Shortcuts (Both Views)
| Key | Action |
|-----|--------|
| ←/→ or h/l | Switch harness |
| ↑/↓ or j/k | Navigate profiles |
| Enter | Switch to selected profile |
| Space | Show details |
| n | New profile |
| d | Delete profile |
| e | Edit profile |
| r | Refresh |
| ? | Help |
| q/Esc | Quit |

## Architecture
```
src/tui/
├── mod.rs                 # Entry point, App, event loop
├── theme.rs               # Shared colors/styles  
├── views/
│   ├── mod.rs             # ViewMode enum, View trait
│   ├── dashboard.rs       # Three-pane dashboard
│   └── cards.rs           # Card grid (feature-gated)
└── widgets/
    ├── mod.rs
    ├── harness_tabs.rs    # Horizontal harness tabs
    ├── profile_table.rs   # Table widget for dashboard
    ├── detail_pane.rs     # Right pane for dashboard
    ├── profile_card.rs    # Single card (feature-gated)
    └── status_bar.rs      # Bottom status bar
```

## Research Findings

### Ratatui Widgets Used
- **Tabs**: Built-in, for horizontal harness navigation with `select()`, `highlight_style()`, `divider()`
- **Table**: Built-in, for profile list with columns
- **Block**: For bordered containers with `bordered()`, `title()`, `padding()`
- **Layout**: Using `Constraint::Length/Fill/Percentage` for responsive layouts

### Third-Party Widgets Evaluated
- **tui-scrollview**: For scrollable detail pane (optional, may not need)
- **tui-cards** (joshka/tui-widgets): Evaluated but using custom implementation
- **tui-tree-widget**: Not needed, flat MCP list sufficient

### Layout Patterns
```rust
// Vertical split
Layout::vertical([
    Constraint::Length(3),  // tabs
    Constraint::Fill(1),    // main
    Constraint::Length(1),  // status
])

// Horizontal split for main area
Layout::horizontal([
    Constraint::Percentage(40),  // profiles
    Constraint::Percentage(60),  // details
])
```

## Dashboard Layout
```

│  [● Claude Code]  [+ OpenCode]  [- Goose]                   │
├─ Profiles ───────────────────┬─ Details ────────────────────┤
│ ● default    sonnet-4  3 MCP │ Profile: default             │
│   test       sonnet-4  0 MCP │ Model: claude-sonnet-4       │
│                              │ Theme: —                     │

│                              │  ✓ filesystem                │
│                              │  ✓ github                    │
│                              │  ✗ postgres                  │
│                              │ Resources                    │
│                              │  Skills: 5    Commands: 3    │
├─────────────────────────────┴──────────────────────────────┤
│ q:quit  ←→:harness  j/k:profile  Enter:switch  n:new  ?    │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

```
│  [● Claude Code]  [+ OpenCode]  [- Goose]                   │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
```

title: Fix profile resource isolation (GitHub #21)
description:
Skills, agents, commands, and plugins installed to one profile leak to other profiles during profile switching.

## Root Cause
In `switch_profile_with_resources` (lifecycle.rs:125), `copy_all_contents()` is additive - it copies files FROM the profile TO the harness directory but does NOT remove files in the harness that don't exist in the profile.

## Bug Flow
1. Profile A has skills installed (harness dir has skills/)
2. Switch to Profile B (empty)
3. `copy_all_contents(B, harness)` copies nothing (B is empty)
4. Skills remain in harness dir from Profile A
5. Switch away from B triggers `save_to_profile(B)`
6. B now has skills it never should have had

## Affected Resources
- Skills: LEAKS
- Agents: LEAKS  
- Commands: LEAKS
- Plugins: LEAKS
- MCP Config: OK (uses file overwrite, not dir merge)

## Fix Strategy
Before copying profile contents to harness, clean the harness directory of managed resources while preserving unmanaged files.

## Test Coverage
10 regression tests added in src/config/manager/mod.rs that currently FAIL, proving the bug exists.

description:
## Overview

Add structured output support (JSON) to bridle CLI display commands, with automatic Nushell detection for seamless shell integration.

## Goals

1. Enable scripting and piping of bridle output in Nushell and other shells
2. Provide `--output` flag with `text`, `json`, and `auto` options
3. Auto-detect Nushell via `NU_VERSION` env var and default to JSON
4. Maintain backward compatibility (text output remains default in non-Nushell shells)

## Design Decisions

| Aspect | Decision | Rationale |
|--------|----------|-----------|
| Primary mechanism | `--output <format>` global flag | Discoverable, explicit, standard pattern (kubectl, gh, docker) |
| Formats | `text`, `json`, `auto` (default) | Auto gives magic UX while flags provide escape hatch |
| Auto behavior | JSON if `NU_VERSION` set, else text | Nushell users get seamless experience |
| Initial scope | `status`, `profile list`, `profile show` | Display/getter commands only |
| JSON structure | Arrays for lists, objects for singles | Best UX for Nushell `from json` and jq |
| NUON | Not supported | JSON is universal, NUON adds maintenance burden |

## Architecture

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                      CLI Commands                           │
│  (status.rs, profile.rs)                                   │
└─────────────────┬───────────────────────────────────────────┘
                  │ uses
                  ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                   Output Module (NEW)                       │
│  src/cli/output.rs                                         │
│  - OutputFormat enum (Text, Json, Auto)                    │
│  - Shell detection (NU_VERSION)                            │
│  - output<T: Serialize + TextDisplay>() helper             │
└─────────────────┬───────────────────────────────────────────┘
                  │ serializes
                  ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    Data Structures                          │
│  ProfileInfo, ResourceSummary, McpServerInfo, StatusInfo   │
│  + #[derive(Serialize)]                                    │
│  + impl TextDisplay for human-readable output              │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Usage Examples

```bash
# Default (auto) - text in bash, JSON in nushell
bridle status
bridle profile list claude

# Explicit JSON (works anywhere)
bridle status --output json
bridle profile list claude -o json | jq '.[] | select(.is_active)'

# Force text in Nushell
bridle status --output text

# Nushell integration
bridle profile list claude | from json | where is_active == true
bridle status | from json | get harnesses | where installed == true
```

## Success Criteria

- [ ] `bridle status -o json` outputs valid JSON
- [ ] `bridle profile list <harness> -o json` outputs JSON array
- [ ] `bridle profile show <harness> <name> -o json` outputs JSON object
- [ ] Running in Nushell auto-detects and outputs JSON
- [ ] `--output text` overrides auto-detection
- [ ] All existing text output unchanged when not using JSON
- [ ] `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` passes
- [ ] Quality gates pass
close_reason: Completed: Nushell-friendly JSON output implemented

title: Goose config.yaml parsing fails entirely with YAML error
description:
Running 'profile show goose test' produces 'ERROR: expected value at line 1 column 1' - the YAML parsing fails completely before any extraction can happen. The Goose config.yaml uses ALL_CAPS keys (GOOSE_MODEL, GOOSE_PROVIDER, etc.) which are valid YAML but may be tripping up the parser. This blocks all Goose profile functionality. Separate from the GOOSE_MODEL key name issue (bridle-ju4).

## Verification Steps

1. Ensure test profile exists:
   ```bash
   cargo run -- profile list goose
   # Should show 'test' profile
   ```

2. Run the failing command:
   ```bash
   cargo run -- profile show goose test
   ```

3. **Before fix**: Shows 'ERROR: expected value at line 1 column 1'

4. **After fix**: Should display profile info without YAML parse errors. At minimum:
   - Path should show correctly
   - No parse errors in output
   - Model may still be '(not set)' until bridle-ju4 is fixed

5. Verify with actual Goose config structure (ALL_CAPS keys):
   ```yaml
   GOOSE_PROVIDER: anthropic
   GOOSE_MODEL: claude-sonnet-4-20250514
   GOOSE_MODE: auto
   extensions:
     developer:
       enabled: true
   ```

title: Claude Code requires plugin structure for skills/commands/agents
description:
## Problem
Claude Code doesn't recognize loose `commands/`, `agents/`, `skills/` directories at the user level. Components must be inside a plugin structure.

## Current Behavior
Installing to `~/.claude/commands/commit.md` - Claude Code ignores this file.

## Expected Behavior
For Claude Code, components should be installed into a bridle-managed plugin:
```
~/.claude/plugins/bridle-installed/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json
├── commands/
│   └── commit.md
├── agents/
│   └── code-reviewer.md
└── skills/
    └── skill-name/
        └── SKILL.md
```

## Fix
1. For Claude Code harness, create a `bridle-installed` plugin if it doesn't exist
2. Install all components into that plugin directory
3. Create proper `plugin.json` manifest
4. OpenCode and other harnesses can continue using flat directory structure

## Research
Per Claude Code docs: 'Plugins are the ONLY way to add skills/commands/agents at user level'
close_reason: Invalid - standalone directories work. Official docs confirm ~/.claude/agents/ and ~/.claude/commands/ are supported without plugin wrapper. See code.claude.com/docs/en/sub-agents and /slash-commands.

title: Profile Switching - atomic switch with backup
description:
## Context
Implements atomic profile switching with backup-before-apply. Most critical phase for data safety.

## Key Changes
- `src/config/manager.rs` - Add backups_dir(), create_backup(), switch_profile()
- `src/cli/profile.rs` - Implement switch_profile() handler
- `Cargo.toml` - Add chrono = "0.4" for timestamp formatting

## Algorithm (switch_profile)
1. Validate profile exists
2. Backup current config to backups/<harness>/<timestamp>/
3. Create staging dir in same parent as target
4. Copy profile -> staging
5. Remove target, rename staging -> target
6. Update BridleConfig.active, save

## Patterns to Follow
- Backup naming: YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SS format
- Staging dir: .bridle-staging-<pid>-<timestamp>
- Always backup before any destructive operation
